channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A Two-Tier Algebraic Schema to Map ${(A^4-C^4)/(D^4-B^4)}$ onto the Natural Numbers
item.description: arXiv:2504.04614v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A brief history and two formulations of the Diophantine problem's requirements are presented. One tier consisting of three two-parameter solutions is studied for its ability to provide examples for the small natural numbers considered. Nested within it is a second tier consisting of five shifted-square solutions of the form $u^2+c$, where $u,c \in Q$. All told, they provide numerical examples for all but two $a \in N[1000]$, the set of natural numbers less than or equal to $1000$. A few open questions remain. Does this scheme of solutions cover every $a \in N[1000]$? If so, might they account for all $a \in N$? Are the three $tier_1$ solutions redundant with respect to the $a's$ they provide? Do other $tier_1$ and shifted-square $tier_2$ solutions exist?
item.dc:creator: Paul A. Roediger

item.title: Investigation about a statement equivalent to Riemann Hypothesis (RH) applied to Dirichlet primitive L functions
item.description: arXiv:2412.00169v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We try to apply a known equivalence, for RH about Riemann Z function, to Dirichlet L functions with primitive characters. The aim is to give a small contribution to the proof of the generalized version of Riemann Hypothesis (RH).
item.dc:creator: Giovanni Lodone
